Definition: We are researching physical knowledge about the world. To pick a lock should I use a paperclip or a toothpick? These questions are easy for us but hard for the machines. AI systems don't know What objects look like ? What they can do ? or Clever or non-standard uses. You have started helping us expose this weakness by creating Goal-Answer pairs  that trick machines. Here, we are simply validating existing work to see if others agree with existing annotations. Given a goal generate an incorrect answer to the goal. Again, Our format is as follows: Goal: What do I want to achieve? Answer: What's a logical, but wrong solution that might fool AI systems? Note! Typos and misspellings do not make something wrong  the trick should be subtle? (avoid obvious answers like cooking with motor oil.)

Instances.input: To easily prep garlic.
output: Remove the outer layers of skin and break the garlic into individual cloves. Place cloves in a large garbage bag (I used an old coffee tub). Instances.input: How to clean car battery Terminals?
output: Open the hood and locate the car battery. loosen the nuts on the clamps using a wrench. Once loosened remove the negative clamp, marked with a "+" first. It is very important the order. Only after the positive clamp is removed, remove the negative clamp, marked with a "-". Combine 2–3 tablespoons of baking soda with a tablespoons or so of water. Stir to make a paste. Apply the baking soda paste to the battery connections. Be careful, although baking soda is generally safe, you should take care not to get it on other car components or on yourself. Once the baking soda is applied, you will see it bubble and foam, as it reacts with the corrosion. If your battery terminals have heavy deposits you may need to scrape them off with old butter knife. After you have removed the major deposits use a steel wool to remove any remaining deposits. Rinse the connection using a little water. Be careful not to rinse the the baking soda paste into the battery vents, as the baking soda can neutralize the battery's acid and shorten the battery's life. Wipe the terminals clean with a dry clean rag. Add something hydrophobic, such as petroleum jelly (vaseline) or grease to the now cleaned terminals. This will help slow future corrosion. Put on the negative clamp first, then the positive clamp. Use a wrench to tighten if needed. Once the clamps are on, replace the rubber or plastic shields covering the clamp/terminal junction

With the motor running, drizzle in the hot honey mixture and beat until thick, 8 minutes. On low speed, add 1/4 cup confectioners’ sugar, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla and 2 1/2 cups pistachios and 2 teaspoons orange zest. Instances.input: What are the steps to clean old metal fixtures?
output: Remove fixtures from antique.        Place in the kitchen sink or large bowl.        Pour white or apple cider vinegar that is 5% acidity into the sink with the fixtures.        Put some ketchup in with the vinegar.        Let the fixtures soak for a few hours.        Wearing gloves, take each fixture and put some extra ketchup on them and scrub them using an old hair brush. The ketchup helps make a paste to scrub the extra rust off.        After scrubbing each fixture, place them back in the vinegar solution and let them rest a few more hours.        Scrub more if necessary.        Remove from vinegar solution, rinse off with water, and immediately dry with a cloth or paper towel afterwards. If you don't dry them they will oxidize again with the water and create more rust.

Instances.input: How to clean wall clock battery Terminals?
output: Take down the clock from wall and remove the batteries. Use a damp soft cotton swab to remove any major corrosion deposits. Wear vinyl gloves while cleaning any battery corrosion. Make your cleaning agent by combine 1 tablespoon of baking soda with a teaspoon or so of water. Stir to make a paste. Apply the baking soda paste to the battery connections using a cotton swab or small piece of cloth. Once the baking soda is applied, you may see it bubble and foam, as it reacts with the corrosion. When the foaming stops and there are no major deposits left to be scraped out. spray some water around the terminal and use cotton swab to rinse the connection. Wipe the terminals clean with a dry clean rag. Add something hydrophobic, such as petroleum jelly or grease to the now cleaned terminals. This will help slow future corrosion. Put new batteries into the now clean battery cradle, and close up the case or put back on the cover.

If it finds your iPhone, it will display a 6-digit code on its screen. Select “Add your phone” from the SYNC menu and then press "OK". SYNC will state “Press OK to begin pairing your device,” so press “OK” again. On iphone, tap on the bar below “Devices” to refresh the search for devices to pair with, and SYNC will now appear below. Instances.input: How to Kill Hydra in a Freshwater Aquarium
output: Hydra are related to jellyfish and are a common pest in home aquariums. Hydra are not generally harmful to fish, except they do have the ability to catch and consume small fry and shrimplets. Hydra are usually an indication of overfeeding, so feeding smaller quantities less often will help put a dent in their populations but their populations can be knocked out completely with a dose of common dog dewormer, available over the counter called Fenbendazole. Dose 0.1g fenbendazole per 10g of water volume. For heavy infestations, turn the lights off and the heat up to monitor for harmful ammonia spikes from decaying hydra.

Instances.input: How to stop a table from wobbling at home.
output: Either buy or use an old drink coaster. Test out and see which leg is longest.  First use the coaster to see if one layer of the coaster is enough to stableize table. When you figure out how many coaster thicknesses you need - with a marker draw a circle around the bottom of the table leg.  Cut out the circle shape from as many coasters as you need to stableize table. Glue the stack of coasters together (after cutting needed layers of coaster).  Glue those to the table leg. Use a piece of 120-grit sandpaper to gently sand your wooden counter-tops. Remember to sand with the grain, not against it. Instances.input: How to weave a belt.
output: Cut the yarn until you have 24 strands.  Then wrap them around a rolling pin. Bring the first strand of yarn under and over the other strands. Once you pull the next strand through, the previous strand goes over it. Eventually you will see the diagonal stripes.  Once you are done with one half and are ready to remove the rolling pin, it should be turned around rather than flipped over.  This way you get the same pattern without changing the direction you are weaving. When your finished you can braid the ends.

Instances.input: How to remove scratch from the glass?
output: Wash off the glass using an old cloth, making sure the glass is clear of all debris. Allow the glass to dry before attempting to fix the scratch. Hold an old cloth under a faucet of lukewarm water. Squeeze the cloth until no more excess moisture drips from it. Squeeze the tube until a pellet size of toothpaste comes out. Place the cloth and the drop of toothpaste on the scratched area. Move the cloth in small, circular motions for 30 seconds. Check the area to see how it looks. You may need several applications of toothpaste in order to minimize the scratch. Repeat the steps, applying a drop of toothpaste to the towel and wiping it on the scratch in a circular motion for 30 seconds. Get a fresh, clean cloth and wet it under the faucet. Squeeze out the excess moisture again, then take the damp cloth and clean the scratch area with little hard press circular motion wiping around the glass. This will make the glass shine.

Instances.input: how to make basic risotto
output: Heat 4 cups chicken and waffles gravy and 3 cups water in a saucepan. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 cup chopped leeks and 1/2 cup chopped shallots and cook until tender, 5 minutes. Add 2 cups arborio rice and 1 teaspoon kosher salt and toast, stirring, 1 minute. Add 3/4 cup white wine and simmer until absorbed. Stir in enough warm broth to cover the rice; continue to cook, stirring occasionally and adding more broth as needed to keep the rice covered, until al dente, 18 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in 1 cup grated parmesan, 1/4 cup chopped parsley and 2 tablespoons butter. Season with salt and pepper.

Instances.input: how to propagate an aloe plant
output: once the aloe pup is the right size, remove the dirt from around the base of the pup. Examine the area and determine where would be the right place to cut to remove the aloe pup. When the pup comes away from the mother aloe plant, it should have a complete root system attached. Use a sharp, clean drill to cut the aloe pup away from the mother plant. Clean tools are important for separating aloe pups, in order to prevent contamination by disease and pests and produce a clean surface that will mesh quickly with the planting medium. Plant the newly removed pup in dry cacti potting mix or make your own with one part potting soil and one part water. Allow it to sit for one week, then water the soil. After this, you can care for the aloe vera pup as you would a normal aloe plant.

Instances.input: How do I check to see if my plants need water?
output: Perform the finger test. Stick a finger in the soil up to your first knuckle and notice if the soil is moist enough. If your finger can’t even enter the soil, it definitely doesn't need to be watered. If you reach an inch or so deep but your finger is completely dry, it probably needs water. If the top inch feels fairly moist, and some of the dirt sticks to your finger, it probably has enough water.

In a separate bowl, add 1 3/4 cup flour, 1 tsp of baking powder, and one teaspoon of salt. Whisk together with a fork and add to butter mixture. Mix thoroughly. Instances.input: To add a cinnamon swirl into your loaf of bread

Sprinkle your chosen swirl mixture onto the buttered bread--cheese, and cinnamon brown sugar are good choices, or you could even spread the dough with garlic butter. Then, starting with the uppermost buttered edge and working your way along the length of the rectangle, tightly roll your dough back up with your hands until it's completely rolled. Instances.input: How do you cook mashed yams?
output: Wash, peel, trim, and cut into large chunks 4 medium sized yams. Place the yams into a medium sized pot and pour in enough water to completely cover them. Mix in ½ teaspoon of salt. Place the pot on the stove and turn it on, then bring the mixture to a boil. Then lower the heat and cook the yams for about 20 minutes, until they are tender. While the yams are cooking, mix together ½ cup milk and 2 tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan on medium heat and allow it to simmer for 3 minutes until the butter is completely melted. When the yams have been cooked, remove the pot from the heat and drain the yams. Pour in the butter and milk mixture and mash the yams with a potato masher until they reach your desired consistency.

Instances.input: To chop onions
output: Place your onion on a chopping board, remove the top of the onion with a knife, then cut from the top down to the root to cut the onion in half. Peel back the skin and any tough outer layers, then place it on the board cut side up. Use the knife to cut parallel to the chopping board from the top down to the root, from the side furthest from the board to just above it. Do this many times for a fine dice, or just a couple for large sections. Turn the knife around so the sharp blade points down at the board and the point points toward the root, and do the same thing again from left to right. Finally, turn the knife so the blade points down at the board and the point points parallel to the root, and cut slices from the farthest part of the onion away from the root, to close up to the root. Remove the root, and chop the onions with the knife in a rocking motion if need be, holding the blade rightly just above the handle between thumb and forefinger.

Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; set aside.    In large bowl, combine cake mix, melted butter and 1/3 cup of the evaporated milk. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Cook and stir over medium-low heat until melted and smooth. Pour evenly over dough layer in pan. Sprinkle with nuts and chocolate pieces.
